#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string longest(vector<string> strings){
    string longest;
    for(auto it=strings.begin();it!=strings.end();it++){
        if(it->size() > longest.size()) longest = *it;
    }
    return longest;
}

zero,and has a fr equenc y greater than or equal to the valueof the integ er  itself.

Examples:
    search({4, 1, 2, 2, 3, 1}) == 2
    search({1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4, 4}) == 3
    search({5, 5, 4, 4, 4}) == -1

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
int search(vector<int> lst){
    int max=0;
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]>max){
            max=lst[i];
        }
    }
    for(int i=0;i<lst.size();i++){
        if(lst[i]==max){
            for(int j=i;j<lst.size();j++){
                if(lst[j]==max){
                    max++;
                }
            }
        }
    }
    return max;
}

For num = "ABED1A33" the output should be 4.
For num = "123456789ABCDEF0" the output should be 6.
For num = "2020" the output should be 2.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
int hex_key(string num){
    int sum=0;
    for(int i=0;i<num.length();i++){
        if(num[i]=='A'||num[i]=='B'||num[i]=='C'||num[i]=='D'||num[i]=='E'||num[i]=='F'){
            sum+=10;
        }
        sum+=num[i]-'0';
    }
    return sum;
}
int prime_number(int n){
    for(int i=2;i<=n/2;i++){
        if(n%i==0){
            return 0;
        }
    }
    return 1;
}
